attributes.action: Prevent the creation of the Hull puppy farm!
attributes.additional_details: The Communities Secretary Greg Clark has allowed an appeal by Yorkshire Evergreen - part of US animal supplier Marshall BioResources - to breed beagle puppies and other animals with the intention of drug testing at a site in Grimston, near Hull.
attributes.background: The government have approved plans to build a puppy farm in Hull, with the intention of breeding animals for testing purposes. Whilst animal testing continues to be a problematic matter throughout the world, we can prevent further suffering and save these animals from a lifetime of pain and neglect.

rejection.details:
We cannot accept duplicate petitions. We think this petition is similar to yours: 

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/104454

You might like to sign this petition instead. It is more likely to get more signatures that way.
